content.title: Marriage Assistance To Differently Abled Women (Parinayam-II)
content.details: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance to Differently Abled Women (Parinayam-II)' was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, the Government of Kerala is providing marriage assistance of ₹30,000/- to differently-abled girls who have completed 18 years of age for their marriage.
benefits: A one-time assistance of ₹30,000/- is provided to the eligible beneficiaries.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala.
The parents of differently abled girls or differently abled girls should be eligible to apply under the scheme.
The girl who intends to be married should have completed 18 years of age.
The combined annual family income should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
documents_required: Certificate to prove the age of the girl
Copy of Disability Identification Card (UDID Card) / Disability Medical Certificate
Bank details- Copy of Pass Book

faqs.question: What is the 'Marriage Assistance to Differently Abled Women (Parinayam-II)' Scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the government of Kerala is providing marriage assistance of ₹30,000/- to differently-abled girls who have completed 18 years of age for their marriage.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The differently-abled girl who intends to be married is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for differently abled women?
faqs.answer: Yes, only the differently abled women are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: Will the financial aid be given to the applicant for her second marriage?
faqs.answer: Yes, after receiving the financial aid as per these terms and conditions, if the marriage has to be dissolved for any reason and the girl has to marry a second time, financial aid can be given for the second marriage.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, a one-time assistance of ₹30,000/- is provided to the eligible beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Is there any criterion for annual family income?
faqs.answer: The combined annual family income should not exceed ₹1,00,000/-.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.

faqs.question: In how many days should the applicant submit the application form?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted at least one month before the date fixed for the marriage.
